name: Black Tea
description: Often sold in a blend of some sort, the flavor depends on the location the plant was grown and the blend it is sold in. Consisting of many varieties, it is the most common type of tea. It supports heart health and boosts the body's defense towards oxidative stress.

name: Green Tea
description: The flavor of green tea is dependent on how it was processed and the location it was grown. Like black tea, it comes in many forms. Each form displays a slightly different flavor. Green tea supports brain and heart health. It boosts mental alertness and contributes to the body's natural protection against oxidative stress. It is great to help in the process of fasting

name: Oolong Tea
description: Also referred to as 'wulong' tea or 'black dragon' tea, oolong tea is a semi-oxidized. The flavor, aroma, and color is dependent on the level of oxidation. Higher oxidation levels contribute to a lighter color, and lower oxidation levels contribute to a darker color. Health benefits include several antioxidants alongside heart and brain health support.

name: Pu-erh Tea
description: Pu-erh undergoes a process that ivolves being hand-tossed in a wok to prevent oxidation followed by aging in a humid environment. This brings out its flavor which is more sharp and creates a dry mouth sensation compared to other teas. Health benefits include support for the heart and healthy skin. It is high in antioxidant properties which also helps with mental alertness.

name: White Tea
description: When harvested, the leaves and buds go through a steam or frying process to stop oxidation. It is then dried. This tea is low in caffeine compared to others. Health benefits include support for dental and brain health. It also assists the body's response to inflammation and has antioxidant properties.

name: Jasmine Tea
description: Jasmine tea is most commonly made from green tea, but other teas can be used as a base. It is made by using flavorings and scents produced from jasmine flowers. Some teas are flavored with natural jasmine essential oil. Jasmine tea provides a relaxing aroma that can lower your heart rate.
